thread.title: Liverpool starlet Brooks Lennon proves he's the real deal with stunning hat-trick as USA Under-20's beat Haiti 4-1
thread.title_full: Liverpool starlet Brooks Lennon proves he's the real deal with stunning hat-trick as USA Under-20's beat Haiti 4-1

author: Jake Polden
title: Liverpool starlet Brooks Lennon proves he's the real deal with stunning hat-trick as USA Under-20's beat Haiti 4-1
text:
Remember the name Brooks Lennon. 
Liverpool's 19-year-old whiz kid proved he is very good value for all the hype surrounding him with a stunning hat-trick in the USA Under-20's 4-1 win over Haiti. 
The Reds U23s striker, who joined Real Salt Lake on loan at the beginning of February, turned out for his national team in the 2017 CONCACAF U20 Championship in Costa Rica on Tuesday. 
The USA, who lost 1-0 to Panama last week, were looking to bounce back in their game with Haiti and it was Lennon who ensured his nation came out on top. Brooks Lennon chips the keeper with ease (Photo: Univision Deportes/Youtube) Lennon had a lot to celebrate in San Jose (Photo: Univision Deportes/Youtube) 
But as the above video shows, it was in fact Haiti who drew first blood at the Estadio Nacional in San Jose, when they took the lead on the quarter-of-an-hour mark. 
Lennon equalised for his side from the spot before Fulham youngster Luca de la Torre put the USA in front when he slammed home a loose ball in the area. 
From there Lennon continued to take the game to the opposition and extended their lead a minute later before completing his hat-trick with a delightful chip on 59 minutes. Lennon's contract at Liverpool is due to expire in six months (Photo: Liverpool FC via Getty Images) 
The teenager's contract is set to expire at Liverpool in six months, when he will return to Merseyside from Real Salt Lake. 
But his recent performances will certainly do no harm to his chances of an extension. poll loading Will Liverpool win the title with Klopp? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
